text: This is a comparison of binary executable file formats which, once loaded by a suitable executable loader, can be directly executed by the CPU rather than being interpreted by software. In addition to the binary application code, the executables may contain headers and tables with relocation and fixup information as well as various kinds of meta data. Among those formats listed, the ones in most common use are PE (on Microsoft Windows), ELF (on Linux and most other versions of Unix), Mach-O (on macOS and iOS) and MZ (on DOS). {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! scope="col" | Format name ! scope="col" | Operating system ! scope="col" | Filename extension ! scope="col" | Explicit processor declarations ! scope="col" | Arbitrary sections ! scope="col" | Metadata ! scope="col" | Digital signature ! scope="col" | String table ! scope="col" | Symbol table ! scope="col" | 64-bit ! scope="col" | Fat binaries ! scope="col" | Can contain icon |- ! scope="row" | OS/360 | OS/360 and successors, and VS/9, mainframe operating systems | style="text-align: center;" | none | | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | GOFF | IBM MVS and z/OS mainframe operating systems | style="text-align: center;" | none | | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | a.out | Unix-like | style="text-align: center;" | none | | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | COFF | Unix-like | style="text-align: center;" | none | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | ECOFF | Ultrix, Tru64 UNIX, IRIX | style="text-align: center;" | none | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | XCOFF | IBM AIX, BeOS, "classic" Mac OS | style="text- align: center;" | none | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | ELF | Unix-like, OpenVMS, BeOS from R4 onwards, Haiku | style="text-align: center;" | none | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | Mach-O | NeXTSTEP, macOS, iOS, watchOS, tvOS | style="text-align: center;" | none | by section | (limited to max. 256 sections) | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | SOM | HP-UX, MPE/ix | | | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | Amiga Hunk | AmigaOS | style="text-align: center;" | none | | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | PEF | "classic" Mac OS, BeOS (PPC only) | style="text-align: center;" | none | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | CMD | CP/M-86, MP/M-86, Concurrent CP/M-86, Personal CP/M-86, S5-DOS, Concurrent DOS, Concurrent DOS 286, FlexOS, S5-DOS/ST, S5-DOS/MT, Concurrent DOS 386, Multiuser DOS, System Manager, REAL/32, DOS Plus | style="text-align: center;" | `.CMD` | (x86 only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | CP/M-68K | CP/M-68K, Concurrent DOS 68K, FlexOS 68K | style="text-align: center;" | `.68K` | (68000 and higher only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | COM (CP/M) | CP/M, MP/M, Concurrent CP/M, Personal CP/M | style="text-align: center;" | `.COM` | (8080/Z80 only) | (BDOS 3 and higher only) | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | COM (DOS) | DOS, OS/2, Windows (except for 64-bit editions), Concurrent CP/M-86 (BDOS 3.1 only), Concurrent DOS, Concurrent DOS 286, FlexOS, Concurrent DOS 386, Multiuser DOS, System Manager, REAL/32, DOS Plus | style="text-align: center;" | `.COM` | (x86 only) | | (Novell/Caldera VERSION etc.) | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | LE, (W3, W4) | OS/2 (2.0 and higher only), some DOS extenders | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXE` | by file (286 and higher only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | LX | OS/2 (2.0 and higher only), some 32-bit DOS extenders | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXE` | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | PE | Windows, ReactOS, HX DOS Extender, BeOS (R3 only) | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXE` | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | PE32+ | Windows (64-bit editions only) | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXE` | by file | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | PIM/XIP | PalmDOS (MINIMAX applications only) | style="text-align: center;" | `.PIM/.XIP` | (x86 only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" id=.exm | DL | MS-DOS System Manager applications (HP LX series only) | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXM` | (186/188 and higher only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" id=.exp | MP | Phar Lap DOS extenders | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXP` | (286 and higher only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | P2 | Phar Lap 16-bit DOS extenders | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXP` | (286 and higher only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | P3 | Phar Lap 32-bit DOS extenders | style="text-align: center;" | `.EXP` | (386 and higher only) | | | | | | | | |- ! scope="row" | GEOS | PC/GEOS, Geoworks Ensemble, NewDeal Office, Breadbox Ensemble | style="text-align: center;" | `.GEO` | (x86 only) | | | | | | | | |} == Notes == == References == Category:Computing comparisons
title: Comparison of executable file formats
